info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 23 at 2:33PM EDT until July 23 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA...EAST CENTRAL BELMONT...SOUTHWESTERN BEAVER...SOUTH CENTRAL BUTLER...ALLEGHENY...GREENE...NORTHWESTERN FAYETTE...WASHINGTON...WESTERN WESTMORELAND...OHIO...MARSHALL... BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES... At 232 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over McDonald, or 8 miles northwest of Canonsburg, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Trees snapped and uprooted. Power outages can be expected. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, Ross Township, Wheeling, McCandless Township, Monroeville, Cranberry, Moon Township, McMurray, and Weirton. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
